November.title: World Television Day
November.description:
World Television Day, proclaimed by the UN General Assembly, marks the anniversary of the date of the first World Television Forum, held in 1996. 

Are you curious about whether your audience watch a lot of TV? Or what their favourite TV programs / series are? Ask them! Or initiate a discussion about the role of TV on your social media, gather celebrities' quotes, and share world rankings.

December.title: Nobel Prize
December.description:
The Nobel Prize, sponsored by the Nobel Foundation, is an annual international award in chemistry, literature, peace, physics, physiology or medicine, and economic sciences. The first Nobel Prizes were awarded in 1901.

Try to engage your audience by talking about some interesting nominees and winners from previous years. In 2018, Kendrick Lamar received the Pulitzer Prize for his album DAMN, but he was not the first pop artist to be acknowledged with an academic award. In 2016, pop singer Bob Dylan won the Nobel Prize in Literature for "having created new poetic expressions within the great American song tradition."

December.title: Hanukkah
December.description: Celebrated over 8 days, Hanukkah is a Jewish holiday that recalls the rededication of the second Jewish Temple in Jerusalem, in the Middle East.

December.title: Christmas
December.description:
Christmas is an annual festival celebrating the birth of Jesus Christ. It is primarily observed on December 25 and is a religious and cultural celebration for billions of people worldwide.

Here’s what you can do to add a festive vibe to your social media:
- Make your own branded Advent Calendar and put in come creativity!
- Create a Christmas playlist: get your followers to pick a Christmassy song and add it to the playlist.
- And be sure to come up with a very merry Christmas offer!

December.title: New Year's Eve
December.description:
In the Gregorian calendar, New Year's Eve is celebrated on December 31. In many countries, this celebration takes the form of social gatherings, with people dancing, eating, drinking, and watching or lighting fireworks. Late night services are also attended by some Christians. 

For most people, the new year is a time to recharge, restart, and get motivated. Run an inspiring New Year’s resolutions contest and choose the top 10 most inspiring resolutions based on likes, shares and reactions.

January.title: Golden Globe Awards 2020
January.description: The annual Golden Globe Awards, now in their 77th year, are presented by the Hollywood Foreign Press Association in recognition and celebration of achievements in film and television.

January.title: Orthodox Christmas Day
January.description: Orthodox Christmas Day is a public holiday in those countries that practice the orthodox religion. People celebrate it by having dinner with their family and attending church.

January.title: Pitti Immagine Uomo
January.description: Held annually in Florence, Italy, Pitti Immagine Uomo is considered to be one of the main fashion events dedicated to menswear.

January.title: Paris Haute Couture
January.description: This event is one of the biggest in the fashion industry. It sees elite designers such as Chanel, Dior and Valentino gather in Paris to show the world their most beautiful collections.

January.title: Martin Luther King Day
January.description: Held on the third Monday in January each year, Martin Luther King Jr. Day is an American federal holiday marking Martin Luther King Jr.’s birthday (15 January). It is seen as a day to promote equal rights in honor of MLK’s campaigns against racial segregation.

January.title: Australian Open
January.description: The Australian Open is an annual tennis tournament held over the last two weeks of January in Melbourne. It is the first of the four Grand Slam tennis events held each year, and is followed by the French Open, Wimbledon, and the US Open.

January.title: Rotterdam Film Festival
January.description: International Film Festival Rotterdam is held late January each year in various cinemas across Rotterdam, Netherlands. Since its 1972 inauguration, it has consistently focused on independent and experimental filmmaking, showcasing emerging talents and established auteurs.

January.title: Sundance Film Festival
January.description: The Sundance Film Festival is the largest independent film festival in the United States. Organized by the Sundance Institute, it takes place every January in Park City, Utah, Salt Lake City, and at the Sundance Resort.

January.title: Chinese New Year
January.description: Chinese New Year is the most important Chinese holiday, and January 25th2020 begins the Year of the Rat in the traditional Chinese calendar. Usually referred to as the Spring Festival in mainland China (although it mostly takes place in winter), it is one of several Lunar New Years in Asia.

January.title: Australia Day
January.description: Australia Day is the official national day of Australia. Celebrated annually on 26 January, it marks the anniversary of the arrival of the first fleet of British ships in New South Wales in 1788. What started out as a celebration of freed convicts, has now become a celebration of the diverse nation that is Australia.

January.title: India Republic Day
January.description: Republic Day is a national holiday in India. It honours the date on which the Constitution of India came into effect on 26 January 1950. Many events and celebrations are organized, including large military parades as well as local and national cultural programs that focus on India’s history and culture.

January.title: Grammy Awards 2020
January.description:
The 62nd Annual GRAMMY Awards is the world's premier music event, which recognizes the best recordings, compositions, and artists of the year. 

How about some predictions? You can give away some small gifts to those followers whose predictions were right.

February.title: Super Bowl 2020
February.description: The Super Bowl is the annual championship game (American football) of the National Football League (NFL) in the US. Its high viewership numbers mean that commercial airtime during its broadcast is the most expensive of the year. The day of the Super Bowl, now widely considered an unofficial national holiday, is known as "Super Bowl Sunday".

February.title: New York Fashion Week
February.description:
An international fashion event, which takes place in February and September of each year. It is one of four major fashion weeks worldwide, and its purpose is to show fashion collections to buyers, the press, and the general public. 

This is the time to talk about the latest trends in your social media! Don't miss this opportunity, especially if you work in the fashion or beauty industries.

February.title: Taiwan Lantern Festival
February.description:
The annual Taiwan Lantern Festival sees thousands of sky lanterns alight over Taiwan’s Pingxi District. Yanshui District also holds a firecrackers ceremony in the Wumiao Temple. The Tainan Yanshui Fireworks Display (known as the"beehive of fireworks") was originally held to protect the town from evil and disease.

The theme of the main lanterns often corresponds with the zodiac signs of Chinese astrology. Make infographics or GIFs with predictions which are related to your product or service. Create your hashtag and engage people to share!

February.title: Carnevale di Venezia (Carnival of Venice)
February.description:
One of Italy’s biggest celebrations, famous worldwide, it includes events from Venetian mask parades to masquerade balls. 

Have a prize draw for a ticket to the stunning Carnival for your audience!

February.title: Oscars Night
February.description: The night of the Oscars, also known as the Academy Awards, is the most popular date in the film industry calendar. There are 24 nominations for achievement in each cinema category during the year.

February.title: World Radio Day
February.description:
World Radio Day, held every February 13th, is an observance day, celebrating radio as a medium.
Radio broadcasting - an invention that changed the world - has recently become less popular than TV and the internet. 

You can create a poll on Twitter and let people guess what song was the most popular in the year 19xx. Later, you can publish the top hit charts from this year.

February.title: St Valentine's Day
February.description: Celebrated around the world, St. Valentine’s Day is recognised as a celebration of love and romance. People give valentine’s cards and gifts - usually flowers or chocolates - to their loved ones.

February.title: London Fashion Week
February.description: Alongside New York, Paris and Milan, London Fashion Week is known as one of the major fashion events. It is also known as the most innovative and original: in 2010 it was the first major fashion week to allow designers to broadcast their collections live on the web!

February.title: Milan Fashion Week
February.description:
Milan Fashion Week is one of the global "Big Four fashion weeks" (together with Paris, London and New York). Held in Milan, Italy it is a semi-annual clothing trade show.

If fashion is your industry, don't leave this event behind! Share your brand's opinion on the new trends, and invite experts to discuss the latest news from Milan Fashion Week.

February.title: Berlinale
February.description: The Berlin International Film Festival, or the Berlinale, is an annual film festival held in Berlin, Germany. The inaugural festival was held in West Berlin in 1951, and since 1978 has been held every February. It is one of the "Big Three" along with the Venice and Cannes Film Festivals.

February.title: Rio Carnival‎
February.description: Considered the world’s biggest carnival, the Carnival in Rio de Janeiro is a festival held every year before Lent which can see two million people per day on the streets. The first Carnival festival was held in Rio in 1723 and today is a colourful and noisy celebration of music and dancing, especially the hugely popular samba.

February.title: Paris Fashion Week
February.description:
One of the global "Big Four fashion weeks" (the others being Milan, London and New York), held semi-annually for spring/summer and fall/winter. 

Want to put a spotlight on this event in your marketing strategy? Organize a public discussion about the standout trends from Paris Fashion week, sharing your brand's vision for them.

March.title: El Clasico
March.description: El Clásico is the name given to any football match between historic rivals Real Madrid and FC Barcelona.

March.title: Isra and Mi'Raj
March.description: The Isra and Mi'raj,also known as the Night Journey and Ascension,is celebrated in different ways across Islamic communities, but many decorate their homes with candles and electric lights and share food, especially sweet food.

March.title: International Women Day
March.description: International Women’s Day, celebrated globally, is a day dedicated to the growing women’s rights movement.

March.title: Holi Festival
March.description: Holi is a popular ancient Hindu festival of love and colours, which lasts for a day and a night. While mainly celebrated in India and Nepal, the diaspora from the Indian subcontinent have also brought it further afield. Bonfires are lit the day before Holi in a process that symbolizes the triumph of good over evil.

March.title: Purim
March.description: Purim is one of the most fun Jewish holidays, but often gets little recognition. Held on the 14th day of the Hebrew month of Adar (usually March or April), Purim commemorates the day Esther, Queen of Persia, saved the Jewish people from execution.

March.title: Formula 1
March.description:
Formula One (also known as Formula 1 or F1), owned by the Formula One Group, is a high-class single-seater auto race. Since its inaugural season in 1950, the F1 World Championship has been one of the world’s premier forms of racing.

Formula 1 is a sport with plenty of interesting facts and details, which may be surprising for amateurs. Make a list of fun facts about Formula 1 (maximum speed, incredible wins, etc.) and post them in the form of an infographic or polls to create more interaction with the content.

March.title: St. Patrick’s Day
March.description:
St. Patrick’s Day is an Irish cultural and religious celebration dating back to Saint Patrick’s death. It is traditionally celebrated with parades and festivals, and the wearing of green shamrock, a national symbol in Ireland. Although an Irish festival, it is celebrated in many countries worldwide.


Ireland has so many legends and interesting stories. Create a storytelling around this holiday. Ask Irish people to share their most incredible stories, legends or myths. Then, make an infographic or inspiring post!

April.title: April Fool's Day
April.description:
Celebrated annually on April 1 in the majority of  European and Western countries, on April Fools’ Day people play funny (or not so funny) jokes and tricks on their family, friends and colleagues.

You can play with your audience by uploading a fun video or a picture with your team.

April.title: Der Klassiker
April.description: Der Klassiker, or the "German Clasico", is the name given to any football match between Borussia Dortmund and Bayern Munich, two of the most successful teams in German football since the Bundesliga was founded in 1963.

April.title: Manchester City - Liverpool
April.description: An English Premier League match between the two most successful teams right now.

April.title: Pesach
April.description: Passover, or Pesach, is one of the most widely celebrated Jewish holiday.

April.title: The Masters Tournament
April.description: The Masters Tournament is one of the four major professional golf championships. Taking place during the first week of April, the Masters is the first major championship of the year. Unlike the other three, it is always held in the same location, Augusta National Golf Club in Georgia, in the southeastern US.

April.title: Siblings Day
April.description:
The annual Siblings Day (also known as National Siblings Day or National Sibling Day) is a holiday in some parts of the United States observed on April 10, which honors the relationships of siblings. 

Ask your followers to tell the most memorable story about their siblings and compete for the best story.

April.title: Easter
April.description:
Easter, also known as Pascha or Resurrection Sunday, is a festival and holiday that celebrates the resurrection of Jesus from the dead.
Alongside the religious celebrations, many countries celebrate Easter with confectionery and decorated baked goods. Eggs, traditionally symbolizing new life, are hard-boiled and dyed, or made of chocolate and brightly wrapped. In many homes, families celebrate Easter by gathering as a family for an Easter meal.

April.title: Earth Day
April.description: Earth Day is a global event that is celebrated with ecological activities (for example, Earth Hour) to show support for and raise awareness of environmental protection issues.

April.title: Start of Ramadan
April.description: For Muslims worldwide, Ramadan is considered the most sacred month of the year. Those who take part fast every day from dawn to dusk, pray and reflect.

April.title: International Jazz Day
April.description:
UNESCO has declared April 30th  as an international day of recognition of the power of jazz to unite people. 
Ella Fitzgerald, Louis Armstrong, Billie Holiday - you're probably humming one of their songs as you read this. And the influence of jazz can be widely seen  - check out this cover of "Seven Nation Army" - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sB6HY8r983c&list=PLtGnTkjhPRRqyVyShVyDGABLm-v6DEQTn&index=2

You can post your team’s favorite jazz songs and suggest that followers share their favorite jazz songs in the comments. Later, you can publish the playlist and get more shares of this post.

May.title: May the 4th Be With You—Star Wars Day
May.description:
The annual celebration of Star Wars. 

Are your audience fans of the legendary film? Even if they’re not, you can still take advantage of this event to create a piece of useful content with the famous "May the Force be with You" motto.

May.title: Eurovision Song Contest
May.description:
Held annually since 1956, the Eurovision is an international original song competition. The majority of entrants are from member countries of the European Broadcasting Union. 

Is your audience aware of this important world cultural event? Ask them!

May.title: Mothers' Day
May.description: Mother's Day is a celebration of motherhood and a recognition of the role of mothers everywhere. On this day it’s common to visit mothers and give them small gifts.

May.title: Cannes Film Festival
May.description: Cannes Film Festival is held annually in Cannes, France. It previews new films across all genres, including documentaries from around the world.

May.title: Laylat al Qadr
May.description: In Islam, Laylat al-Qadr, also known as the Night of Destiny, is the night when the prophet Muhammad received the first revelation of the Quran. Muslims believe it to be the best time of the year to pray for forgiveness and blessings.

May.title: Eid al-Fitr
May.description: Eid al-Fitr is a religious festival that celebrates the end of the month of Ramadan. Translated as the "Festival of the Breaking of the Fast", it is celebrated by Muslims worldwide and can go on for several days.

May.title: Roland-Garros
May.description: The French Open, known officially as Roland-Garros, is a major tennis tournament, beginning in late May and held over two weeks at the Stade Roland-Garros in Paris.

May.title: Europa League Final
May.description: The 2020 UEFA Europa League Final is the final match of the 2019–20 UEFA Europa League. This is the 49th season of Europe's secondary club football tournament organised by UEFA.

May.title: Champions League final
May.description: The 2020 UEFA Champions League Final is the final match of the 2019–20 UEFA Champions League. This is the 65th season of Europe's premier club football tournament organised by UEFA. Formerly the European Champion Clubs' Cup, it is the 28th season since it was renamed the UEFA Champions League.

June.title: World Bicycle Day
June.description:
World Bicycle Day is on June 3rd. In April 2018 it became an official United Nations day of awareness about the many benefits of using the bicycle, both for transport and for leisure.

The bicycle is the most eco friendly mode of transport. So why not engage your followers to keep our planet safer together and encourage them to travel to work by bicycle? You can start with your team and post a photo of all your colleagues who rode their bikes to work.

June.title: UEFA European Championship
June.description: Informally known as the Euros, the UEFA European Football Championship is the primary association football competition for senior men's national teams of UEFA members, and determines the continental champion of Europe.

June.title: Copa América
June.description: CONMEBOL Copa América, formerly known as the South American Football Championship, is a major men's football tournament featuring national teams from CONMEBOL, theSouth American Football Confederation.

June.title: 24 Hours of Le Mans
June.description: The 24 Hours of Le Mans (French: 24 Heures du Mans) is the world's oldest active sports car endurance race, held annually since 1923 near the town of Le Mans, France. Considered one of the world’s most prestigious races it has been referred to as the "Grand Prix of Endurance and Efficiency".

June.title: Fathers' Day
June.description: Father’s Day is a celebration dedicated to the father of the family and to the role of fatherhood

June.title: Glastonbury Festival
June.description:
England’s Glastonbury Festival is a five-day contemporary performing arts festival that takes place in Somerset. As well as contemporary music, festival goers can enjoy dance, theatre, comedy, circus, and cabaret, among other acts. It is often headlined by leading pop and rock artists, alongside many others.

Think outside the box! Make your own playlist to share with your audience or launch a competition to offer tickets to the festival for the most creative poster created specially for the festival.

June.title: Dragon Boat Festival
June.description: The Dragon Boat Festival is a traditional Chinese holiday that takes place on the 5th day of the 5th month of the traditional Chinese calendar, giving the festival its alternative name, the Double Fifth Festival. It is a festival of traditions and superstitions and its most important activity is dragon boat racing.

June.title: Tour de France
June.description: The Tour de France is an annual men's multi-stage bicycle race which takes place over 23 days in 21 day-long stages, similar to the Giro d'Italia and Vuelta a España Grand Tours. Although primarily held in France, it also passes through neighboring countries.

June.title: Wimbledon
June.description: The Wimbledon Championships is the world’s oldest tennis tournament and has been held at the All England Club in Wimbledon, London, since 1877. Better known as just ‘Wimbledon’, it is played on outdoor grass courts.

June.title: NBA Finals
June.description: The annual championship series of the National Basketball Association, the NBA Finals see the Eastern and Western conference champions play a best-of-seven game series to declare the league champion.

June.title: NHL Finals
June.description: The Stanley Cup playoffs is a National Hockey League elimination tournament. Four rounds of a best-of-seven series determine the league champion and the winner of the Stanley Cup.

July.title: Tenet
July.description: Tenet is a 2020 action thriller film written and directed by Christopher Nolan and produced by Nolan and Emma Thomas.

July.title: First man on the Moon
July.description:
This year celebrates the 50th anniversary of the day that man first stepped on the moon’s surface. "One small step for man, one giant leap for mankind."

Create a small quiz about space conquest in the 20th century, and announce that you will randomly pick 10 winners from the highest scoring participants. The prize can be branded space food.

July.title: Comic Con International
July.description:
Comic-Con International is an annual four-day entertainment and comic convention held in San Diego, California. The original Comic-Con primarily showcased comic books and science fiction/fantasy film, television, and popular arts, but has grown to include a larger range of pop culture and entertainment elements across nearly all genres.

Put superheroes at the heart of your campaign. Create a vote for your audience’s favourite superheroes, reveal some surprising facts about them or, if you are really into this, create your own superhero related to your industry and a comic to go with it :)

July.title: Olympic Games
July.description: The Summer Olympic Games, also known as the Games of the Olympiad, were first held in 1896. This major international multi-discipline event is held once every four years.

July.title: Eid al-Adha
July.description: Eid al-Adha or Eid Qurban, also known as the "Festival of the Sacrifice", is one of two Eid’s (Celebration Festivals) in Islam celebrated worldwide each year. Considered holier than Eid al-Fitr, it marks the end of the annual Hajj pilgrimage.

August.title: Tu B'Av
August.description: Tu B'Av is a minor Jewish holiday. In modern-day Israel, it is celebrated as a holiday of love, not unlike Valentine's Day, and is said to be a "great day for weddings".

August.title: Islamic New Year
August.description: The Islamic New Year falls on the first day of the first month in the Islamic lunar calendar. It is seen as a time for reflection and prayer in which Muslims reflect on the year that has passed and look forward to the year to come.

August.title: India Independence Day
August.description: Independence Day is celebrated each year on 15 August, and is a national holiday in India. On the day, people commemorate the nation's independence from the UK on 15 August 1947. Families spend time together, and many fly kites as a symbol of independence.

August.title: Venice International Film Festival
August.description: The Venice Film Festival, also known as the Venice International Film Festival, is the oldest film festival in the world. It is one of the "Big Three" film festivals, alongside the Cannes and Berlin International Film Festivals.

August.title: UEFA Super Сup
August.description: The UEFA Super Cup is an annual football match organised by UEFA. The reigning champions of the two main European club competitions, the UEFA Champions League and the UEFA Europa League, compete for the title.

August.title: US Open
August.description: The United States Open Tennis Championships is a hard court tennis tournament.

September.title: Labour Day
September.description: Labour Day, with its origins in the labour union movement, is celebrated annually. It celebrates the achievements of workers, and is also considered the unofficial end of summer.

September.title: Video Games Day
September.description:
Gaming is pervasive in our culture, inspiring films, soundtracks, and even themed restaurants. Video Games Day acknowledges and celebrates this defining part of our culture, allowing us to share it with our fellow gamers.

A quiz is one of the quick and easy social media activities. Create one like "which *VIDEO GAME* character are you?"and design result cards, so people can share these with their friends.

September.title: Octoberfest in Munich
September.description:
Germany’s annual Oktoberfest is the world's largest beer festival. Held over 16 to 18 days, the folk festival attracts more than six million visitors from around the world every year and is an important part of Bavarian culture. During the event, visitors consume large quantities of Oktoberfest Beer.


Don't be afraid to be creative and even a bit crazy! Create a contest or selfie challenge for the funniest costume and give away a hamper with the best beer to the winner :)

September.title: Sukkot
September.description: Sukkot, which is variously known as the Feast of Tabernacles, the Festival of Ingathering, or the Festival of Shelters, is a biblical Jewish holiday. It is celebrated on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, Tishrei.

September.title: Google Birthday
September.description:
In 1998, two Stanford Phd. students launched a new search engine. Their ambitious mission was to organize the world’s information, making it universally accessible. Who can compete with this search engine giant today? 

We're using Google products every day, so let people guess how many products Google have by creating a Twitter poll.

September.title: Rosh Hashanah
September.description: The Jewish New Year, Rosh Hashanah, is literally translated as "head [of] the year". Its biblical name is Yom Teruah, or "day of shouting or blasting".

October.title: Mid-Autumn Festival
October.description: The Mid-Autumn Festival, also known as the Moon Festival or Harvest Moon Festival, is primarily celebrated by Chinese and Vietnamese people. It always falls on the day of a full moon, and is a time for families to spend time together, often eating ‘mooncakes’.

October.title: Columbus Day
October.description:
Columbus Day honors the discovery of America.

Encourage your followers to share the story of how they discovered your product for the first time.

October.title: Dussehra
October.description: Vijayadashami, also known as Dussehra or Dashain, is a major Hindu festival celebrated on the tenth day of the month of Ashvina (September–October). It symbolizes the victory of good over evil. The celebrations are lively, and include fireworks and theatre, food offerings and prayer meetings.

October.title: Halloween
October.description: Halloween, on the night before All Saints’ Day, is widely celebrated in most Western and European countries. Dedicated to remembering the dead, on Halloween people go to fancy dress parties, carve pumpkins, watch horror films and tell scary stories; children dress up as monsters or movie characters and go door-to-door trick-or-treating.

November.title: Diwali
November.description: Diwali, also known as Deepawali, is the five-day long Hindu festival of lights. One of Hinduism’s most popular festivals, the lights of Diwali symbolise the spiritual triumph of good over evil. Every autumn, millions of people celebrate with fireworks, prayers and festive events.

November.title: Thanksgiving Day
November.description: Thanksgiving Day originated as a harvest festival when the first pilgrims shared their food with Native Americans. Traditional Thanksgiving activities include a family dinner, and there is also a huge parade in New York.

December.title: Total Solar Eclipse
December.description:
A total solar eclipse occurs when the new moon comes between the Sun and the Earth. The darkest part of its shadow, known as the umbra, is cast on the Earth.

Become the one who provides an exclusive online broadcast of this amazing event. You can get a huge number of views for your YouTube channel.
